intro: Allomorphia sertulifera, commonly known as the clustered allomorph, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Allomorphia sertulifera thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
